reviews.review_msg: Awesome professor! Has a passion for teaching (and life in general). She wants her students to do well and has fun with the course as well. Would definitely recommend taking a course taught by her.

She's very knowledgable and her notes are great. Everything you need to know is in the notes. Lectures don't help because not only she just reads off the slides but also it's all memorization and there's nothing to explain. Key thing is that you MUST go to the open labs if you want to do well. Ask her as many questions as you can in the lab.

I left her a rough review for KIN 325, then took KIN 326 b/c I switched majors. Different experience. She is very nice and answers any question you ask (unlike many profs).  A little unclear with assignments, but exams are reasonable.  Bottom line: Anatomy is tough. I spent a lot of time going into open lab. You really have to prep for the lab exam

There's no doubt anatomy is a tough subject. I spent a lot of time studying for this. You have to go into this course with a mindset for actually LEARNING rather than memorizing. Going to the open labs really helped me. I enjoyed this class and thought Dr. Anthony gave reasonable exams and she tried to make us laugh with her somewhat corny jokes :)

i'm surprised at all the nasty comments posted so far...anthony's a great teacher! She really cares about students and even asked me why I skipped a lab. She tries really hard to make us laugh, and her jokes are so lame that we do :)

She's one tough cookie!  Yes, its a mandatory course for majors... its a tough course, but very useful.  STUDY STUDY STUDY MEMORIZE the hell out of everything (word for word).  Dont get the text.  The cadavre was cool.

An unfortunate experience, to say the least. While she clearly knows her material, her lecturing skills need fast improvement. Cannot answer questions gracefully - will focus on making you feel like you asked a stupid question rather than actually answering the question. Mandatory course for KIN majors...
her notes are way too scattered to follow. she reads about 1000 words/min. her lab exam was intense but lecture was fair. tough class, but you have to do it.

I hate Anthony.  She does know her stuff, but is so incredibly picky on exams.  and for what?  We aren't anatomy buffs... Just take what you think you got and take off 10% immediately.   She wont even answer questions in class unless she asks you something. I mean, Im not asking cuz it feels good... stupid. HATE I SAY, HATE.
A lot of stuff to memorize, especially for the lab component. Be sure to go in for open lab. Exams were fair, but you need to know everything.
amazing prof, dedicated and knows her**** - you memorize and keep on top of the material -you're golden. - if you don't, don't complain.
She just can't shut up during the lab quizes! She seems nice enough, but then she'll screw you on exams.  There's a ton of material in this class.

WICKED teacher... she was very helpful and clear about what she wanted for exams. Forget the textbook and make sure u know ur notes inside out. Alotta material but the course is interesting. oh yeah and make sure u spend alotta time in the lab - HELPED ME
